page.title: 06BOATING ON THE RIVER FOWEY
page.content: Nowadays, almost all boating is for pleasure, and on a busy summer weekend you can see all kinds of craft coming upstream to{Lerryn}on the tide, or stopping to picnic on one of the grassy banks. Launches from{Fowey}also bring passengers to Lerryn for either tea at the W.I. hall or a meal at "The Ship Inn". Small hire motor boats, rowing boats, sailing dinghies, canoes and now even windsurfers, enliven the scene with their brightly coloured sails. However, an occasional working {fishing boat}can be seen going downstream from{Lostwithiel}to the fishing grounds out at sea, later to land their catch at Fowey. Local poeple and holidaymakers enjoy fishing from small boats at high water on the river.
